My wife and I visited with our baby daughter and both of our mums. This restaurant is genuinely and honestly exceptional.  

I can say that because I am extremely fussy, and in London, the only restaurant to eat Arabic food in is the one in knightsbridge next to Harvey Nichols called Ishbilia they also have a place in Harrods and honestly the food is comparable, just as tasty, just as good! And that is saying something. 

The service is fantastic. We had the pleasure of meeting Mohammed, he met all of our needs and couldn’t do enough to help. 

The restaurant is definitely worth a visit. If you are fussy with your food, like I have any only one high-quality tasty food that can be trusted.

reviews.text: The first I have tried the Fish & Chips out of a friend’s recommendation which turned out amazing, went again the next day for the Shrimps pasta it blew my mind , thanks to chef Linda for the amazing home made cooking.
reviews.title: Totally amazing

reviews.text: We were recommended Linda's fish and chips by a friend and we were not not disappointed. As a brit that has not had fish and chips in 5 years I was soooo surprised with this place. The fish was fresh and the batter light and crispy. The portion was huge too. I expected it to be pub grub but it was much better. Also linda the chef/owner was extremely friendly and flexible to our requests. I wanted curry sauce on the side and she had the most delicious fragrant sauce readily available! My husband had a veggie version of tempura veggies enough to feed an army! The prices were also excellent especially for such high end food. Amongst a sea of mediocre empty cafes in Sharm this place is a total gem! Were coming back tomorrow!!
reviews.title: Excellent food!

reviews.text: Our favourite restaurant in Naama. We have never had a bad meal in the Blue Fountain. Real home cooked food with plenty of flavour. A wide selection on the menu even for the fussiest of diners. Spotlessly clean throughout.

reviews.text: Very very impressed, my girlfriend and I are on holiday in Sharm al Sheikh over the Christmas period, we heard about Linda’s Christmas dinner and couldn’t say no. It lived up to and passed the expectations we had, the food was excellent, service impeccable and the atmosphere felt like home away from home!! Thank you very much to Linda and the staff for a lovely evening.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text:
Recently stayed in Naama Bay for a couple of months and unfortunately it wasn’t till my last week that l discovered this place as it’s a little off the beaten track.
The whole place is impeccably clean and the decor ethnic but very stylish. 
The meal was of very high quality and perfectly prepared and presented. We were a party of 5 and the variety of meals ordered were all of a very high standard. 
Will certainly be my <go too> eatery on my future visits to Naama Bay.
reviews.title: BEST RESTAURANT IN NAAMA BAY .... NO QUESTION!

reviews.text:
We had the most fabulous time at the Blue Fountain. 
Having been to Sharm multiple times we have always struggled to find decent restaurants that serve good food! 

The Blue Fountain for us is the best place to eat and meet new people. Linda the owner is so welcoming and she really makes you feel at home, Linda has a fabulous sense of humour. Linda’s husband is also very kind. The staff at the Blue Fountain couldn’t do more to help us, meals served hot and very quick. The quality of food is just out of this world. We had the Fish & chips, steak, Sunday roast.. the list is endless. Deserts were exceptional

The Blue Fountain also has free Wi-fi for customers and it is the best Wi-fi we have come across in Sharm El Sheikh! 

We will be returning in January and the fist place we will visit is the Blue Fountain! 

Thank you Linda and team for such a fabulous time at the restaurant you made our holiday so much more enjoyable! 

See you soon
reviews.title: Best Place in Sharm El Sheikh

reviews.text:
When you hear that a restaurant is good then one takes it with a pinch of salt, but THE BLUE FOUNTAIN in Sharm has to be one of the BEST places that I’ve eaten. Not only the reputable Fish and Chips (like no other) but the Sunday roast too. Linda and the team have surpassed any expectations and beyond. The Blue Fountain is certainly worth a visit. 

Should you need reminding of which customer this is, it was the one that ensured that three roast dinner plates and three pudding plates were cleared. 

If the proprietors are reading this, Thank you do so much. 

Marcus Collins
reviews.title: When you hear that a restaurant

reviews.text:
After a disappointing meal at the Thai restaurant in the same building, we were nervous as to how authentic the Indian restaurant in Soho  Square would be, given the similar number of 5 star reviews from people with only one review to their name...

However, our starters were tasty - chicken pakora, lightly battered and seasoned well, and crispy onion bhajis with flavoursome dips.   For mains we both had the "madras" which we were told had cream in it - they did it for us both without cream - one vegan one chicken, mine extra spicy, and they were both great. You could actually taste the spices in mine, and it was hot and full of a rich smoky flavour, as was the tarka dhal I also ordered.  Made from scratch from basic ingredients, not just a pureed base. It was unique and wonderful. Fluffy rice and nan bread completed the very filing meal.

Excellent price and attentive service.

Still, it was so good, we came back the next day and had more !
reviews.title: Excellent food

reviews.text:
A wonderful welcome from the lovely staff on our second visit. 

Delicious Greek dishes in a lovely setting - screened from the hustle and bustle of Soho Square. 

Octopus salad and anchovy salad are wonderful fresh, perfectly dressed and superbly balanced flavour-wise. A great start to the meal. 

This time Tess was not that hungry so just one main - succulent herby and delicately spiced grilled chicken. Last time an excellent beef stifado for Tess and tender, delightful roast octopus for me. 

Just about room left to share a desert - Kataïfi is a traditional pastry made with a nut filling and soaked in a sugar or honey. This is THE best we’ve ever had. You can tell there are Greek chefs in the kitchen. 

Added to all the above - beautiful live guitar and bouzouki music. Not tacky tourist stuff, but evocative and expressive by a skilled musician. I’m a live music promoter back home and I really rate this guy. The real treat for us was room to dance, of which we took plenty of advantage.
reviews.title: Superb Greek food, lovely staff and setting.

name: L'entrecote Steak House
rankingString: #13 of 355 places to eat in Sharm El Sheikh

reviews.text:
Wide range of excellent cuts from local rib eye to top of the shop wagu. 

Comfortable elegant setting more akin to New York than Sharm el Sheikh. But somehow it works. Low level lighting, wood panelling and a fell of old world luxury. 

The food and service are both excellent. The meats cooked bang on to order. I went for Egyptian rib eye as I couldn’t personally see how meat flown in from Australia could be much better. If the chef knows what he or she is doing then it should be good. And it is. Absolutely perfectly seasoned, juicy, charred on the outside and delicious. Everything you want from a good steak. Top notch chips and veg with a deep and spicy pepper sauce on the side. I had creamed spinach as a side dish - so good I ordered another half way through my meal as I’d polished the first one off. 

Tess wasn’t that hungry so she had two appetisers. Kicking off with their “classic wedge” salad - crunchy fresh salad with onion straws, beef bacon and to-die-for blue cheese crumble - an Egyptian blue that is identical to Roquefort. All dressed perfectly with French dressing. 

Next up - mini rib-eye. Juicy slices of steak with chimmichuri, garlic yogurt, sliced red onion and crunchy coated onion rings. Wonderful according to Tess. 

Attentive but not intrusive service from a lovely waitress and the restaurant manager. 

One to make sure you visit.
reviews.title: Steaks are high… standard!

reviews.text:
Great location, easy parking. Great decor, staff very polite, food amazing, great selection. Animal friendly!  Highly recommended. The owners definitely makes everyone welcome. 

Also Lovely to see that they support the street dogs of Nabq too,  backed by the south Sinai veterinary association (who sponsor TNR)
reviews.title: Lovely Bar in Nabq - a must try!

reviews.text:
In Sharm, you will see and hear about Arab Bucks before you see it or visit because it's the place to be 😉 The new restaurant is amazing, the staff have worked so hard to get where they are today xx Well done Everyone xxxx 

For food they have a vast menu to choose from to suit everyone, and the prices are so affordable!! Your average family of 5 meal with drinks will not break the bank and you'll leave with a full tum, memories you'll never forget and the most important part, you'll leave as a friend ☺❤️
As for the review about the dogs, these dogs are cherished and cared for kindly and respectfully by the locals and the owner and are not a problem, if anything they are the highlight of the night as they look for little belly rubs and love 😍

The atmosphere is very much chill and easy, kick your shoes off and enjoy the shisha by Mohamed who sees it as an art... Then you'll be served with a smile and laugh by all the amazing waiters!!!

Food varies from pizza, pasta, chicken, steaks, sandwiches, salads, seafood and much more... Dishes average at £5 and drinks are amazing 💖 so much choice!!!!
Absolute gem of a place... You will love it, go before you leave, you won't regret it 😉 xxxx
reviews.title: Egyptian Diamond.... Food, drinks, shisha, and most importantly atmosphere 🤲❤️
